isis.stitle: 530 and DT-466/408 Diesel Engine Service (1994) - NOZZLES - NOZZLES - INSTALLATION

step1.para: Thoroughly clean nozzle bore in cylinder head before reinserting nozzle holder assembly. Pay particular attention to seating surfaces, in order that no small particles or carbon will cause assembly to be cocked or permit blow-by of combustion gases. Don't use hard or sharp tools for cleaning. Blow out with filtered compressed air.

important.para: BE SURE TO USE NOZZLE SEATING BRUSH ZTSE4391 WHEN CLEANING CLEANING NOZZLE BORE.

step1.para: Remove the nozzle tip protective caps and install the nozzle assemblies into each sleeved bore. Be sure a new copper gasket is in place. Use a dab of grease to hold the gasket in place.

Install the nozzle retainers (crabs) and tighten the bolts to the special torque value. Refer to Figure 12.15
.
Remove the protective caps and install the high pressure fuel lines as described previously in this section. Tighten connector nuts to the special torque value.
Prime the fuel injection system as described in Section 11 under " FUEL INJECTION PUMP".
